result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mico Blagojevic

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mico Blagojevic appeared by video.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty appeared by video for Mico Blagojevic.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  No objection from the State.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Zoom appearances approved by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 14, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Mico Blagojevic in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Mico Blagojevic.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests an additional status date to allow time for blood results to come back.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-22-2022

Defendant Mico Blagojevic in court, appeared in person with attorney Mark P. Powers, appeared in person.  James C Griffin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mico Blagojevic in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 070306,
Payable Number: 1022069,
Receipt Number: 22RP030038,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Mico Blagojevic in court with attorney Alexander R. Huppertz.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/26/22 @ 1:30p
